title: Metacognition-Based Multimedia Learning Design: Optimizing Redundant Text for Mathematical Concept Understanding

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Aims to improve mathematical problem-solving abilities in blended (face-to-face/online) classes using digital devices, with learning outcomes measured through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain the cognitive effects of three multimedia types (redundant/complementary/concise text).
Learners can select optimal multimedia designs for math concept learning with 80% accuracy using metacognitive strategies.
Learners can produce learning materials that reduce redundant text errors by 50% in project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
